headline: Russia ramps up all kinds of recruitment efforts to support its war effort
description: Since summer 2025, Russian authorities have struggled to find the thousands of soldiers needed to replenish units suffering ever heavier losses. They have kept the threat of a general mobilization hanging over the country, and volunteers have been replaced by men sent to the front lines after near-forced enlistment.

headline: Mexico deploys 10,000 troops to restore order after violence linked to the death of drug lord 'El Mencho'
More than 200 inmates launch hunger strike to seek benefits under Venezuela's new amnesty law
UK police release ex-envoy Peter Mandelson on bail in Epstein case
description: Mandelson, a pivotal figure in British politics and the UK's former envoy to Washington, was arrested on suspicion of misconduct in public office early Monday evening. His arrest came just days after the former prince Andrew was detained.

headline: China's retired rural workers are finding rest impossible
description: In rural China, meager pensions are forcing many retired farmers into urban exile, where survival depends on taking the most precarious jobs.

headline: The secrets of neighing are finally revealed
description: To produce this unique sound, the horse performs a 'biphonation': It cries out and whistles at the same time.

headline: Will French investigators soon use American DNA databases to solve cold cases?
description: In the SURE bill submitted on February 19, the justice minister plans to introduce an article that would, in particular, allow 'the use of genetic genealogy' in certain cases. These DNA samples come from 'recreational' tests offered by companies over the internet.

headline: US accuses China of increasing its nuclear arsenal
After Heineken announces job cuts, the beer market faces major upheaval
In North Korea, Kim Jong-un's sister elevated to the highest levels of power
'Here Gaza,' and the rebirth of radio within the devastated territory
Snowstorm in northeastern US leaves 40 million people under weather warnings
War in Ukraine: 'The key issue is to deter Russia from attacking again'
We fact-checked 'Marty Supreme,' the biopic of a not-so-visionary table tennis player
Nearly 20 countries condemn Israel's annexation of the West Bank
Giorgia Meloni's strong poll numbers, a deceptive success
Lyon drug traffickers hire Colombian hitmen to kill their rivals
With expected US retreat, Germany seeks to strengthen its role within NATO
France to revoke US envoy Kushner's government access after no-show
The 'impossible' task of counting deaths at sea
description: The International Organization for Migration and migrant aid NGOs simultaneously record deaths at sea in the Mediterranean and Atlantic, but often come up with very different figures. Why?

headline: Dark Bank: American suspected of leading an international criminal organization extradited to France
description: Huzefa Hafiz Ismail arrived on French soil on Friday. He was arrested in August 2024 in Texas at the request of French judicial authorities, who suspect him of leading a vast money laundering network.

headline: Oleksandr Syrsky, commander of the Ukrainian army, to Le Monde: 'Russian army losses have exceeded its recruitment level'
description: The Ukrainian commander-in-chief told Le Monde that, despite a 'very difficult' situation on the battlefield, his army continued to resist 'the most powerful army in Europe' and to 'foil' Russian military plans.

headline: Vladimir Putin, trapped by his own logic of war
Tariffs: 'Donald Trump has just learned the hard way: In the United States, the law is king'
A stinging rebuke for Donald Trump on tariffs
